lines.text: Actually... I think the answer to that question answers another question, too.
Huh? What question?
Not one we asked, but...
You can see the bullet in the <c=#0000FF>Living Memory,</c> right?
Yeah? So the Stop Wizard saw the guy shoot. What're you gettin' at?
Well... you ever see a gunshot, Leo? Like, you ever actually see the bullet?
I... huh.
It's normally too fast to see, right?
But the memory shows a bullet hanging right there, in that exact spot. He got a good look at it.
Where are you goin' with this?
I'm thinking that this <c=#FF00FF>isn't</c> a snapshot of the moment the bullet was fired.
I think when Slick fired the gun, the Stop Wizard was casting a <c=#FF00FF>different</c> spell!
A different spell? Like...?
Like <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum!</c>
The spell freezes everything in view- which probably included his friend over there.
He had Slick, a bullet, and the Go Wizard all frozen in place- and he needed to do something before it wore off.
He couldn't get his buddy out of the way, so...
...instead, he took one of the <c=#FF0000>Go Wizard's</c> stickers and held it in front of the bullet.
Then, once he dispelled the freeze... bang! The bullet started moving again, and hit the sticker!
That's... wait. Wouldn't it rebound and hit the gun, not Slick?
Um... I don't know a lot about ballistics, but I do know recoil is a thing.
You can actually kind of see it in the hologram- his arm's already started moving off-center.
If you line it up... it looks like if you flipped the bullet around, it'd go straight for where we saw the wound.
...So it would. Color me impressed, kid.
With that out of the way... let's just wrap up the rest of this.
